attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
·       A physical stock take of raw materials and finished product was conducted on 21 March 2025 to determine whether the stocks movement at the branch was well managed and to assess the effectiveness of existing controls.

·       The findings were as shown below:

ü  Polybags had a variance of +358 Pieces

ü  Finished product had a variance of -8 pieces.

ü  The other raw materials had nil to negligible variances as illustrated below:

Table 1:Stock verification Summary.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should check the root cause of positive polybags variation.
attributes.effect: Finished product immaterial variations imply that bread stock controls are working effectively, significant +variations in polybags implies that there were lapses in proper recording of good issue sent for polybags.

value: Stock controls will be maintained, we will do a follow up on +positive variation of polybags.
Stock was okey, manager to check the cause of the positive polybags variations and check on good issue sent.
In the prior audit report dated 18th February 2025, it was noted that poly bags had+106 pieces, Bread stock had -67 pieces, the other raw materials had immaterial variances.
Current

attributes.title: Crates Verification
attributes.description:
·     A review of the crates balances at branch was done on 21 March 2025 to establish whether the controls for crates movement were sufficient.

·       It was noted that crates had a nil variance with the book and system record as seen below:

Table 2:Crates movement.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to maintain crates controls.
attributes.effect: The crates movement was well controlled.

value: We will maintain the controls.
Manager to maintain proper recording
In prior audit report dated 18th February 2025, it was noted that crates had nil variations.
Current

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       A spot check was done at the cash office to determine if cash balances agreed with the cashflow records as at 21/03/2025 and to determine if cash controls in place were working effectively.

·       An immaterial variations of +3 was noted, however there was a pending IOU of cash Kshs 8,000 expense for sewage unblocking, that was past 3-day clearance policy.

·       Below is a summary of the spot check:

Table 3:Cash verification.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch management to follow up on clearance of pending IOUs.
attributes.effect: The cash controls were adequate and effective, however, there was need to follow the IOU clearance period policy.

value: We are expecting approval of pending IOU pending anytime soon.
We are expecting approval of pending IOU pending anytime soon.
In the prior audit dated 18thFebruary 2025, it was noted that cash had nil variations, however there were pending IOUS Worth KES 8,000 relating to sewage expenses dated 12/02/2025
Current

attributes.title: Bread weight analysis
attributes.description:
·       Packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market were randomly weighed to determine if they were of correct/standard weight as per the KEBS standards weight measures.

·       Underweights were noted across all varieties:

ü  400 g butter was 32% underweights.

ü  400 g CTW was 20% underweights.

·       A detailed summary of the findings is seen below:

Table 4:Bread Weights.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should adhere to the set weight ranges and ensure set production procedures are keenly followed to ensure correct weight is being achieved.
attributes.effect: The underweights observed indicate lapses in the proper flow of production procedures and incorrect dough weight management.

value: ·       Generally, there was worn out of oven casket, but the issue has already been rectified and overstay of bread in cooling wires, but we are working on it to minimize % of underweights noted.There is also an issue with the current outlet fan not working properly hence this is contributing to moisture loss, but the issue has been reported to KAF waiting for maintenance.

·       Generally, there was worn out of oven casket, but the issue has already been rectified and overstay of bread in cooling wires, but we are working on it to minimize % of underweights noted.There is also an issue with the current outlet fan not working properly hence this is contributing to moisture loss, but the issue has been reported to KAF waiting for maintenance.
·       In the previous audit report, Underweights were as seen ,400CTW had 33% and 400g BT had 14.6%
Current

attributes.title: Bread Damages analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis was done on the bread damage levels for both production and market-based deformities for the period of 31 days from 18 February 2025-20 March 2025 to determine if the quality standards set for the branch were being followed.

·       The analysis revealed that the:

ü  Production of bread damages stood at 0.24% of total production which exceeded the set limit of 0.2%

ü  Market damages stood at 0.42% of total sales, which was within the allowable threshold of 0.5%.

·       A detailed summary of the findings is as seen below:

Table 5:Production damages.

NB: The production damages analysis above excludes 139 oven damages.

Table 6:Market damages.
attributes.recommendation: ·  Enhance controls within the production process to ensure bread produced is of good quality thereby minimizing possibility of excess production damages.Branch management to follow up on replacement of worn-out tins.
attributes.effect: Production damages exceeded the allowable rate by 0.04% with a cost implication of Kshs. 4,498.17 which implies that there was failure to adhere to the correct operating procedures which in turn affected the bread quality leading to excess production damages.

value: ·       Major issue of excess production damages is due to worn out tins, we are waiting for supply/delivery soonest.Market damages were within the allowable range to be maintained.
·       Major issue of excess production damages is due to worn out tins, we are waiting for supply/delivery soonest.Market damages were within the allowable range to be maintained.
·   In the prior audit it was noted that production damages were 0.22% of the total production while market damages were 0.35% of the total sales.Damages sent to ingredient had +2.97 Kgs.

attributes.title: Production efficiency.
attributes.description:
·      A review of the branch’s management use of human capital resources availed to the production section was done by computing production efficiency to determine if the allocation of production workers was as per the set company KPI of 4.3 bags per production workers.

·       The analysis covered a period of 31 days from 18 February 2025 to 20 March 2025, It was noted that the production efficiency was at 4.69 bags per production workers which was above the KPI as detailed below:

Table 7:Production efficiency.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should enforce the controls and make further improvements.
attributes.effect: The branch attained and surpassed its target implying efficient allocation of production workers based on planned production.

value: Production efficiency to be maintained.
Production efficiency to be maintained.
In the previous audit report, it was noted that production efficiency was at 4.85 bags per production workers.
Current

attributes.title: Packing effficiency
attributes.description:
·     A review of packing efficiency was done for a period of 31 days from 18 February 2025 to 20 March 2025 to determine if packers were being optimally utilized by achieving there KPI of 97 crates per packer.

·      It was noted that packing efficiency stood at 94.97 crates per packer, which was below the standard of 97 crates.

Table 8:Packing efficiency.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management to ensure optimal allocation of packers based on the set standards.
attributes.effect: The branch did not attain the set slicing efficiency, the company incurred an extra cost of Kshs 2,736 to hire extra 3 workers.

value: Noted to be worked on.
Noted to be worked on.
The previous audit report indicated a packing efficiency of 94.05 crates per packer.

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis.
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of both the mixing chart and mixing chart summaries for the period of 31 days from 18 February 2025 to 20 March 2025 was done to determine if the raw materials’ consumption were as per the set BOM and to determine if the set yield and quality standards were achieved for production.

·       It was noted that:

ü  Average yield was 190.98 loaves per bag

ü  Average production was 35.84 bags equivalent to 79.64% of the set target of 45 bags.

ü  Utto units’ consumption to bags of flour ratio was 1:1

ü   No cases of remixes were observed for the reviewed audit period as detailed in the table below:

Table 9:Mixing Chart analysis.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch management to improve on production target achievement.
attributes.effect: Branch production capacity is not being fully utilized by 20.36%, which implies there is need for improvement.

value: Average production was affected by shift cuts due to low sales and the rest of 25 bags for bread transfers.
Average production was affected by shift cuts due to low sales and the rest of 25 bags for bread transfers.
In prior audit report dated, Average yield was at 191.00 loaves per bag, average production was at 40.10 bags which represent 89% of the target of 45 bags.
Current

attributes.title: Minishop spot check
attributes.description:
·   A spot check on Mini shop was done on 21 February 2025 to determine if all loaded bread was accounted for and if the sales were equivalent to the till balances given that the mini shop did not accept physical cash.

·       It was noted that all sales were all accounted for, however there were customers who had paid for bread in advance as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: The management should maintain the Mini shop controls however they should avoid advance payments.
attributes.effect: All sales and bread balances were accounted for which indicated that the Mini shop controls were effective.

value: We don’t allow advance payments, Mini-shop customers to be advised to pay upon receipt of bread, we will liaise with sales team to educate newly recruited Mini shop sales team on issue with payments.
We don’t allow advance payments, Mini-shop customers to be advised to pay upon receipt of bread, we will liaise with sales team to educate newly recruited Mini shop sales team on issue with payments.
In prior audit report dated 18th February 2025, mini-shop spot check had nil variations.
Current

attributes.title: Debtors analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of the debt balances as at COB 21 March 2025 was performed to identify any occurrences of bad debts or unresolved balances by route.

·       There were a cumulative total of KES 89,608.5 debtors balances as of 21 March 2025 and one dormant customer Mini-shop Ngara with a balance of KES10,394 as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: ·       Sales rep to follow up on the pending balances to be cleared.
attributes.effect: Debt balances are  well controlled; however, efforts should be made to recover the pending balances.

value: Debts balances are below the security deposit, supa point and extra cent.
Debts balances are below the security deposit, supa point and extra cent.
In the prior audit report, it was noted debtors’ balances as of 18th February were at Kshs 13,293.22
Current

attributes.title: Vehicles fuel consumption
attributes.description:
·        Vehicles’ fuel consumption analysis was done for a period of 28 days from 1 February to 28 February to determine if fuel consumption was within the set standard rates.

·       It was noted that fuel allocation was done as per the number of kilometers covered as detailed below:
attributes.recommendation: Maintain and enhance the fuel management controls within the branch.
attributes.effect: The fuel consumption was well controlled.

value: Fuel consumption controls to be maintained.
Fuel consumption controls to be maintained.
In the prior audit report, it was noted that Vehicle fuel consumption was within the set standard rate.
Current
